paralegal.title: Paralegal
paralegal.tagline: AI reads the documents. Humans build the case.

tasks.description: AI reviews millions of documents for relevance, privilege, and key terms in hours instead of weeks.
AI searches case law, statutes, and regulations with natural language queries and citation analysis.
AI extracts clauses, flags risks, and compares contracts against templates and standards.
AI generates first drafts of motions, briefs, and filings from templates and case facts.
AI manages deadlines, court filings, and case calendars with automated reminders.
Managing client relationships, gathering information, and providing updates requires human empathy.
Organizing exhibits, preparing witnesses, and supporting trial strategy needs human judgment.
Assisting attorneys with strategic decisions, identifying arguments, and case theory development.

companies.name: Relativity
companies.threat: AI-powered e-discovery replacing teams of document reviewers

companies.name: Thomson Reuters
companies.threat: AI legal assistant that researches, drafts, and analyzes at attorney speed

companies.name: Harvey AI
companies.threat: GPT-powered legal AI handling research, drafting, and analysis for law firms

companies.name: Ironclad
companies.threat: AI contract lifecycle management eliminating manual contract review

companies.name: Everlaw
companies.threat: AI litigation platform automating document review and case analysis

timeline.description: AI handles 70% of document review and research. Paralegal demand drops 30%. Focus shifts to client work.
AI handles most legal research and drafting. Paralegals become case managers and client liaisons.
Routine paralegal work automated. Remaining roles focus on trial support, client management, and complex case coordination.

skills.description: Master Harvey, CoCounsel, and Relativity — be the paralegal who does 5x the work.
Human-centered case coordination and client communication.
Courtroom preparation, exhibit management, and trial support.
Specialize in regulatory compliance — healthcare, financial, or environmental.
Manage complex legal matters with multiple stakeholders and deadlines.

contract-lawyer.title: Contract Lawyer
contract-lawyer.tagline: AI drafts the contract. Humans negotiate the terms.

tasks.description: AI generates NDAs, MSAs, SOWs, and employment agreements from templates and parameters.
AI reviews contracts, flags non-standard clauses, and suggests alternative language.
AI maintains approved clause libraries and ensures consistency across agreements.
AI checks contracts against regulatory requirements and internal policies.
AI extracts key terms, dates, and obligations from contracts into structured data.
Negotiating high-stakes terms, understanding business priorities, and creative deal structuring is human.
Drafting bespoke agreements for novel transactions requires deep legal expertise.
Advising clients on contractual risk, liability exposure, and strategic positioning.

companies.name: Ironclad
companies.threat: AI CLM platform that drafts, reviews, and manages contracts with minimal human input

companies.name: Harvey AI
companies.threat: AI legal assistant that drafts and reviews contracts at attorney quality

companies.name: Luminance
companies.threat: AI that reviews and negotiates contracts autonomously

companies.name: SpotDraft
companies.threat: AI contract management for legal teams, automating the entire workflow

companies.name: Juro
companies.threat: AI-native contract platform enabling self-serve contracting for business teams

timeline.description: AI handles 70% of standard contract work. Contract lawyer demand drops for routine agreements.
AI drafts and reviews most commercial contracts. Lawyers focus on complex deals and negotiation.
Standard contracts fully automated. Contract lawyers focus on M&A, IP, and high-stakes commercial deals.

skills.description: High-stakes M&A, licensing, and partnership negotiations.
Tech, healthcare, or finance contract expertise commands premium.
Implement and manage AI contract tools across the organization.
GDPR, HIPAA, SOX — compliance-heavy contracting.
Strategic legal advice that shapes deals, not just documents them.

legal-researcher.title: Legal Researcher
legal-researcher.tagline: AI searches the cases. Humans build the argument.

tasks.description: AI searches and analyzes case law with natural language, finding relevant precedents instantly.
AI scans statutes, regulations, and legislative history for relevant provisions.
AI verifies citations, checks for overruled cases, and maps citation networks.
AI generates research memos with analysis, citations, and conclusions from research questions.
AI compares laws across jurisdictions but nuanced interpretation needs human analysis.
Crafting creative legal theories and novel arguments requires human legal reasoning.
Advising on litigation strategy based on research requires experienced legal judgment.

companies.name: Thomson Reuters
companies.threat: AI legal research that finds and analyzes precedents faster than any human

companies.name: LexisNexis
companies.threat: AI-powered legal research with conversational search and auto-generated summaries

companies.name: Harvey AI
companies.threat: AI legal researcher that produces attorney-quality memos from questions

companies.name: vLex
companies.threat: AI legal research assistant covering 100+ jurisdictions globally

companies.name: Anthropic
companies.threat: General AI that performs legal research and analysis at high quality

timeline.description: AI handles 80% of routine legal research. Research assistant roles shrink significantly.
AI produces comprehensive research memos. Researchers focus on novel arguments and strategy.
Legal research largely automated. Human researchers work on cutting-edge legal theory and appellate strategy.

skills.description: Master CoCounsel, Harvey, and AI-powered Westlaw/Lexis for 10x productivity.
Novel legal arguments and appellate strategy — the creative legal thinking.
Deep expertise in securities, environmental, or healthcare regulation.
Persuasive legal writing that goes beyond AI-generated drafts.
Multi-state and international legal research capabilities.

compliance-officer.title: Compliance Officer
compliance-officer.tagline: AI monitors compliance. Humans interpret the gray areas.

tasks.description: AI tracks regulatory changes across jurisdictions and flags relevant updates.
AI scans operations against policies and flags violations automatically.
AI screens transactions for money laundering, sanctions violations, and suspicious activity.
AI generates regulatory reports, dashboards, and filings from operational data.
AI manages compliance training programs, tracks completion, and identifies gaps.
AI identifies risks but assessing impact and designing mitigation requires human judgment.
Interpreting ambiguous regulations and applying them to specific situations needs legal expertise.
Investigating compliance breaches and designing remediation plans requires human judgment.
Building a compliance culture and ethics program requires human leadership.

companies.name: Ascent
companies.threat: AI regulatory knowledge platform that auto-maps regulations to obligations

companies.name: ComplyAdvantage
companies.threat: AI-powered AML/KYC screening replacing manual compliance checks

companies.name: LogicGate
companies.threat: AI GRC platform automating risk assessment and compliance workflows

companies.name: Chainalysis
companies.threat: AI blockchain compliance tracking transactions across crypto platforms

companies.name: CUBE
companies.threat: AI regulatory intelligence that auto-classifies and maps regulatory obligations

timeline.description: AI handles 65% of monitoring and screening. Compliance officers focus on interpretation and strategy.
AI monitors compliance continuously. Officers focus on risk strategy and regulatory relationships.
Routine compliance automated. Human officers focus on ethics, culture, and complex regulatory matters.

skills.description: Shape compliance programs that balance risk management with business objectives.
EU AI Act, algorithmic fairness, data privacy — the new frontier of compliance.
Lead compliance investigations and design effective remediation.
Navigate multi-jurisdictional compliance — GDPR, SOX, AML across borders.
Build organization-wide compliance culture — the human leadership layer.

medical-coder.title: Medical Coder
medical-coder.tagline: AI assigns the codes. Humans catch the nuances.

tasks.description: AI reads clinical notes and assigns diagnosis codes with high accuracy.
AI maps procedures to CPT codes from operative reports and clinical documentation.
AI captures charges from clinical documentation reducing missed revenue.
AI audits coding accuracy and flags potential compliance issues.
AI identifies denial patterns and suggests corrective actions.
Multi-diagnosis, surgical, and specialty coding requires deep clinical knowledge.
Training physicians on documentation and querying for clarification is human.

companies.name: 3M
companies.threat: AI-powered computer-assisted coding replacing manual medical coders

companies.name: Optum
companies.threat: AI coding solution that auto-assigns codes from clinical documentation

companies.name: Nuance
companies.threat: AI clinical documentation and coding integrated into the physician workflow

companies.name: AGS Health
companies.threat: AI medical coding service replacing offshore coding teams

companies.name: Fathom
companies.threat: AI that generates clinical notes and assigns codes simultaneously

timeline.description: AI handles 75% of routine coding. Coder demand drops 30%. Focus shifts to complex cases and auditing.
AI handles most coding with human oversight. Coders become coding auditors and compliance specialists.
Medical coding largely automated. Remaining roles focus on compliance, education, and complex specialty coding.

skills.description: Audit AI coding output and ensure regulatory compliance.
Work with physicians to improve documentation quality.
Complex surgical, oncology, or cardiology coding expertise.
Broader RCM knowledge beyond coding — denial management, AR follow-up.
Bridge clinical coding and health IT systems.

radiologist.title: Radiologist
radiologist.tagline: AI reads the scan. Humans make the diagnosis.

tasks.description: AI detects breast cancer in mammograms with accuracy matching or exceeding radiologists.
AI detects pneumonia, tuberculosis, and lung nodules in chest X-rays with high sensitivity.
AI triages urgent findings like stroke, PE, and hemorrhage for immediate radiologist attention.
AI identifies fractures that may be missed on initial review, serving as a safety net.
AI auto-measures tumors, organs, and vessels with precision, tracking changes over time.
Multi-system pathology, rare conditions, and clinical correlation require expert radiologist judgment.
Image-guided procedures, biopsies, and treatments require physical human expertise.
Discussing findings with clinicians and contributing to treatment planning is human.

companies.name: Viz.ai
companies.threat: AI that detects strokes and other emergencies from CT scans, triaging cases instantly

companies.name: Aidoc
companies.threat: AI radiology platform analyzing CTs for dozens of conditions simultaneously

companies.name: Lunit
companies.threat: AI detecting cancer in mammograms and chest X-rays with superhuman accuracy

companies.name: Qure.ai
companies.threat: AI interpreting X-rays and CTs for TB, lung cancer, and more — especially in underserved areas

companies.name: RapidAI
companies.threat: AI stroke detection and treatment decision support used in thousands of hospitals

timeline.description: AI serves as 'second reader' in screening. Radiologists are more efficient but still essential for diagnosis.
AI handles routine screening independently. Radiologists focus on complex cases and interventional work.
AI reads most routine studies. Radiologists become imaging consultants and interventionalists.

skills.description: Image-guided procedures — physical skills AI cannot replace.
Master AI tools to read 3x more studies with higher accuracy.
Neuroradiology, MSK, cardiac — complex subspecialties harder to automate.
Become a clinical consultant, not just a film reader.
Oversee AI diagnostic tools — critical safety role.

pharmacist.title: Pharmacist
pharmacist.tagline: AI fills the prescription. Humans provide the care.

tasks.description: Robotic dispensing systems and AI handle counting, labeling, and dispensing medications.
AI screens for drug-drug, drug-allergy, and drug-disease interactions in real-time.
AI handles insurance verification, prior auth submissions, and claims processing.
AI flags optimization opportunities but comprehensive medication reviews need pharmacist expertise.
AI predicts demand, optimizes stock levels, and manages automatic reordering.
Explaining medications, addressing concerns, and ensuring understanding requires human connection.
Rounding with physicians, managing complex drug therapy, and clinical decisions need expertise.
Administering vaccines, health screenings, and point-of-care services require physical presence.

companies.name: Omnicell
companies.threat: Automated pharmacy dispensing systems replacing manual dispensing entirely

companies.name: ScriptPro
companies.threat: Robotic prescription filling handling high-volume dispensing

companies.name: Amazon
companies.threat: AI-powered online pharmacy with automated dispensing and free delivery

companies.name: CoverMyMeds
companies.threat: AI prior authorization automation eliminating manual insurance processing

companies.name: Capsule
companies.threat: Tech-enabled pharmacy with AI workflow optimization and same-day delivery

timeline.description: Robots handle 80% of dispensing. Pharmacists shift to clinical services and patient care.
Dispensing fully automated. Pharmacists become medication therapy managers and clinical specialists.
Retail pharmacy as dispensing role largely extinct. Pharmacists are clinical care providers and medication experts.

skills.description: Direct patient care, medication management, and physician collaboration.
Oncology, HIV, transplant — complex medications requiring expert management.
Personalized medicine based on genetic testing — the future of pharmacy.
Manage medication therapy for patient populations — analytics-driven pharmacy.
Chronic disease management in clinical settings — expanding pharmacist scope.

medical-transcriptionist.title: Medical Transcriptionist
medical-transcriptionist.tagline: AI transcribes the visit. This role is nearly extinct.

tasks.description: AI transcribes physician dictation with 99%+ accuracy across accents and specialties.
AI generates clinical notes from patient-physician conversations in real-time.
AI formats transcriptions with proper medical terminology, abbreviations, and structure.
AI self-checks transcription quality but complex cases may need human verification.
AI routes transcribed notes directly into the correct EHR fields automatically.
Highly specialized medical reports with rare terminology may still need human review.

companies.name: Microsoft/Nuance
companies.threat: AI clinical documentation that eliminates transcription entirely by auto-generating notes

companies.name: Abridge
companies.threat: AI that listens to patient visits and generates structured clinical notes in real-time

companies.name: DeepScribe
companies.threat: Ambient AI scribe that documents visits without physician input

companies.name: Suki
companies.threat: AI voice assistant for physicians that generates notes from conversations

companies.name: Nabla
companies.threat: AI copilot for doctors that auto-generates notes and handles documentation

timeline.description: AI handles 90%+ of transcription. Role has shrunk 70% already. Remaining positions are QA-focused.
Medical transcription role essentially ceases to exist as a standalone profession.
Completely automated. No standalone medical transcription roles remain.

skills.description: Transition to CDI — improving physician documentation quality.
Natural transition from transcription to coding — similar domain knowledge.
Broader HIM roles managing health data, privacy, and records.
Quality assurance of AI-generated clinical documentation.
Leverage clinical knowledge in administrative healthcare roles.

therapist.title: Therapist / Counselor
therapist.tagline: AI can listen. But healing requires human connection.

tasks.description: AI generates session notes from therapy conversations, reducing administrative burden.
AI administers and scores standardized assessments (PHQ-9, GAD-7) between sessions.
AI chatbots deliver CBT exercises, mindfulness techniques, and psychoeducational content.
AI handles scheduling, reminders, insurance verification, and billing.
Building genuine trust, empathy, and therapeutic alliance is irreplaceably human.
Diagnosing mental health conditions requires clinical judgment and human observation.
Creating personalized treatment plans requires understanding the whole person.
Managing suicidal ideation, acute crises, and safety requires human presence and judgment.
Facilitating group dynamics and family systems work is deeply human.

companies.name: Woebot Health
companies.threat: AI CBT chatbot providing 24/7 mental health support — supplement, not replacement

companies.name: Wysa
companies.threat: AI mental health companion for mild-moderate symptoms

companies.name: Talkspace
companies.threat: AI-augmented therapy platform matching patients and assisting therapists

companies.name: Lyssn
companies.threat: AI that evaluates therapy quality and provides feedback to therapists

companies.name: Spring Health
companies.threat: AI-powered mental health platform that triages and matches patients to care

timeline.description: AI handles admin and supplements between sessions. Therapist demand actually GROWING due to mental health crisis.
AI chatbots handle mild anxiety and psychoeducation. Therapists focus on complex cases and relationships.
AI provides tier-1 mental health support. Human therapists handle complex trauma, personality disorders, and deep healing work.

skills.description: EMDR, somatic experiencing, and complex trauma — the deepest human healing work.
Use AI tools to enhance efficiency while focusing on the human connection.
Master virtual therapy delivery for broader reach and flexibility.
Couples, families, addiction, eating disorders — niche expertise adds value.
Build and lead therapy practices — the entrepreneurial path for therapists.

nurse.title: Nurse (RN)
nurse.tagline: AI monitors the vitals. Humans provide the care.

tasks.description: AI continuously monitors vitals and alerts nurses to deterioration patterns before they become critical.
AI assists with barcode scanning, dosage verification, and real-time documentation.
AI generates nursing notes from voice input and structured assessments.
AI assists with initial triage scoring but clinical judgment and observation remain critical.
AI helps track care plans and coordinate between providers but advocacy remains human.
Physical assessment, wound care, IV management, and hands-on nursing is irreplaceable.
Advocating for patients, explaining conditions, and providing emotional support is deeply human.
Rapid clinical decision-making in emergencies requires experienced human judgment.
Teaching patients about their conditions and self-care requires personalized human communication.

companies.name: Philips
companies.threat: AI patient monitoring that detects deterioration hours before human observation

companies.name: Microsoft/Nuance
companies.threat: AI clinical documentation reducing nursing documentation burden by 50%

companies.name: GE HealthCare
companies.threat: AI hospital operations management optimizing patient flow and staffing

companies.name: Eko
companies.threat: AI-powered stethoscope that detects heart murmurs and AFib

companies.name: Viz.ai
companies.threat: AI clinical intelligence alerting nurses to critical findings in real-time

timeline.description: AI reduces documentation burden 40%. Nursing shortage persists — AI makes nurses more efficient, not redundant.
AI handles most monitoring and documentation. Nurses focus on direct care and clinical judgment.
Nursing remains essential. AI augments but cannot replace hands-on care, advocacy, and human connection.

skills.description: Become a nurse practitioner or nurse anesthetist — highest-value, most autonomous nursing roles.
ICU and ER nursing — high-acuity environments where human judgment is most critical.
Bridge nursing and technology — implement and optimize clinical AI systems.
Nurse management, quality improvement, and healthcare administration.
Oncology, cardiac, pediatric — specialized nursing commands premium and is harder to automate.
